ayat.meaning: In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful.
All praise is for Allah—Lord of all worlds,
The Most Compassionate, Most Merciful,
Master of the Day of Judgment.
You alone we worship and You alone we ask for help.
Guide us along the Straight Path,

ayat.arabic: صِرَاطَ الَّذِينَ أَنْعَمْتَ عَلَيْهِمْ غَيْرِ الْمَغْضُوبِ عَلَيْهِمْ وَلَا الضَّالِّينَ
ayat.meaning: The path of those You have blessed—not those You are displeased with, or those who are astray.
In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful.
Say, 'I seek refuge in the Lord of humankind,'
The Sovereign of humankind,'
The God of humankind,'
From the evil of the retreating whisperer—'
Who whispers into the hearts of humankind—'
From among the jinn and humankind.'
In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful.
Say, 'I seek refuge in the Lord of the daybreak'
From the evil of what He has created,'

ayat.transliteration: Wa min sharri ghāsiqin idhā waqab
ayat.meaning: And from the evil of the darkness when it settles,'
And from the evil of the blowers in knots,'

ayat.transliteration: Wa min sharri ḥāsidin idhā ḥasad
ayat.meaning: And from the evil of an envier when he envies.'
In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful.
Say, 'He is Allah—the One.'
Allah—the Sustainer and Protector, the Eternal Refuge.'
He has never had offspring, nor was He born.'
And there is none comparable to Him.'
In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful.

ayat.transliteration: Tabbat yadā abī lahabin wa tabb
ayat.meaning: May the hands of Abu Lahab be ruined, and ruined is he.

ayat.arabic: مَا أَغْنَىٰ عَنْهُ مَالُهُ وَمَا كَسَبَ
ayat.transliteration: Mā aghnā 'anhu māluhū wa mā kasab
ayat.meaning: His wealth will not avail him or that which he gained.
He will burn in a Fire of blazing flames,
And his wife as well—the carrier of firewood,
Around her neck will be a rope of palm fiber.
In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful.
When the victory of Allah has come and the conquest,

ayat.arabic: وَرَأَيْتَ النَّاسَ يَدْخُلُونَ فِي دِينِ اللَّهِ أَفْوَاجًا
ayat.transliteration: Wa ra'aitan-nāsa yadkhulūna fī dīnillāhi afwājā
ayat.meaning: And you see the people entering into the religion of Allah in multitudes,

ayat.arabic: فَسَبِّحْ بِحَمْدِ رَبِّكَ وَاسْتَغْفِرْهُ ۚ إِنَّهُ كَانَ تَوَّابًا
ayat.transliteration: Fasabbih bihamdi rabbika wastaghfir'h, innahū kāna tawwābā
ayat.meaning: Then exalt [Him] with praise of your Lord and ask forgiveness of Him. Indeed, He is ever Accepting of repentance.
In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful.
Say, 'O you disbelievers,
I do not worship what you worship,
Nor do you worship what I worship,
Nor will I worship what you have worshipped,
Nor will you worship what I worship,
For you is your religion, and for me is my religion.'
In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful.
Indeed, We have granted you, [O Muhammad], al-Kawthar.
So pray to your Lord and sacrifice [to Him alone].
Indeed, your enemy is the one cut off [from all goodness].
In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful.
Have you seen the one who denies the Recompense?
For that is the one who drives away the orphan,
And does not encourage the feeding of the poor.
So woe to those who pray
[But] who are heedless of their prayer—
Those who make show [of their deeds]
And withhold [simple] assistance.
In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful.
For the accustomed security of the Quraysh—
Their security in the winter and summer journeys—
Let them worship the Lord of this House,

ayat.arabic: الَّذِي أَطْعَمَهُم مِّن جُوعٍ وَآمَنَهُم مِّنْ خَوْفٍ
ayat.transliteration: Al-ladhī aṭ'amahum min jū'in wa āmanahum min khawf
ayat.meaning: Who has fed them, [saving them] from hunger, and made them safe, [saving them] from fear.
In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful.

ayat.arabic: أَلَمْ تَرَ كَيْفَ فَعَلَ رَبُّكَ بِأَصْحَابِ الْفِيلِ
ayat.transliteration: Alam tara kayfa fa'ala rabbuka bi'aṣḥābil-fīl
ayat.meaning: Have you not considered, [O Muhammad], how your Lord dealt with the companions of the elephant?
Did He not make their plan into misguidance?
And He sent against them birds in flocks,
Striking them with stones of hard clay,
And He made them like eaten straw.
In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful.
Woe to every scorner and backbiter
Who collects wealth and [continuously] counts it
Thinking that his wealth has made him immortal
No! He will surely be thrown into the Crusher
And what can make you know what is the Crusher?
It is the fire of Allah, [eternally] fueled
Which mounts directed at the hearts
Indeed, it [the fire] will be closed down upon them
In extended columns
In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful.
By time,
Indeed, mankind is in loss,

ayat.arabic: إِلَّا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ وَتَوَاصَوْا بِالْحَقِّ وَتَوَاصَوْا بِالصَّبْرِ
ayat.transliteration: Illal-ladhīna āmanū wa 'amiluṣ-ṣāliḥāti wa tawāṣaw bil-ḥaqqi wa tawāṣaw biṣ-ṣabr
ayat.meaning: Except for those who have believed and done righteous deeds and advised each other to truth and advised each other to patience.
In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful.
The competition for [worldly] increase has distracted you
Until you visit the graves
No! You are going to know
Then no! You are going to know
No! If you only knew with knowledge of certainty
You will surely see the Hellfire
Then you will surely see it with the eye of certainty
Then you will surely be asked that Day about the pleasures
In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful.
The Striking Calamity -
What is the Striking Calamity?
And what can make you know what is the Striking Calamity?
It is the Day when people will be like moths, dispersed,
And the mountains will be like wool, fluffed up.
Then as for one whose scales are heavy [with good deeds],
He will be in a pleasant life.
But as for one whose scales are light,
His home will be the Abyss.
And what can make you know what that is?
It is a Fire, intensely hot.
In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful.
By the racers, panting,
And the producers of sparks [when] striking
And the invaders at dawn,
Then thereby raising dust,
And thereby penetrating into the center collectively,
Indeed mankind, to his Lord, is ungrateful.
And indeed, he is to that a witness.
And indeed he is, in love of wealth, intense.

ayat.arabic: أَفَلَا يَعْلَمُ إِذَا بُعْثِرَ مَا فِي الْقُبُورِ
ayat.transliteration: A-falā ya'lamu idhā bu'thira mā fil-qubūr
ayat.meaning: But does he not know that when what is in the graves is scattered
And that within the breasts is obtained,
Indeed, their Lord with them, that Day, is [fully] Aware.
In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful.
When the earth is shaken with its [final] earthquake
And the earth discharges its burdens
And man says, 'What is [wrong] with it?'
That Day, it will report its news
Because your Lord has commanded it.

ayat.arabic: يَوْمَئِذٍ يَصْدُرُ النَّاسُ أَشْتَاتًا لِّيُرَوْا أَعْمَالَهُمْ
ayat.meaning: That Day, the people will depart separated [into categories] to be shown [the result of] their deeds.

ayat.arabic: فَمَن يَعْمَلْ مِثْقَالَ ذَرَّةٍ خَيْرًا يَرَهُ
ayat.transliteration: Famay ya'mal mithqāla dharratin khayray yarah
ayat.meaning: So whoever does an atom's weight of good will see it,

ayat.arabic: وَمَن يَعْمَلْ مِثْقَالَ ذَرَّةٍ شَرًّا يَرَهُ
ayat.transliteration: Wa may ya'mal mithqāla dharratin sharray yarah
ayat.meaning: And whoever does an atom's weight of evil will see it.
In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful.

ayat.arabic: لَمْ يَكُنِ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا مِنْ أَهْلِ الْكِتَابِ وَالْمُشْرِكِينَ مُنفَكِّينَ حَتَّىٰ تَأْتِيَهُمُ الْبَيِّنَةُ
ayat.transliteration: Lam yakunil-ladhīna kafarū min ahlil-kitābi wal-mushrikīna munfakkīna ḥattā ta'tiyahumul-bayyinah
ayat.meaning: Those who disbelieved among the People of the Scripture and the polytheists were not to be parted [from misbelief] until there came to them clear evidence -

ayat.arabic: رَسُولٌ مِّنَ اللَّهِ يَتْلُو صُحُفًا مُّطَهَّرَةً
ayat.meaning: A Messenger from Allah, reciting purified scriptures
Within which are correct writings.

ayat.arabic: وَمَا تَفَرَّقَ الَّذِينَ أُوتُوا الْكِتَابَ إِلَّا مِن بَعْدِ مَا جَاءَتْهُمُ الْبَيِّنَةُ
ayat.transliteration: Wa mā tafarraqal-ladhīna ūtul-kitāba illā mim ba'di mā jā'athumul-bayyinah
ayat.meaning: Nor did those who were given the Scripture become divided until after there had come to them clear evidence.

ayat.arabic: وَمَا أُمِرُوا إِلَّا لِيَعْبُدُوا اللَّهَ مُخْلِصِينَ لَهُ الدِّينَ حُنَفَاءَ وَيُقِيمُوا الصَّلَاةَ وَيُؤْتُوا الزَّكَاةَ ۚ وَذَٰلِكَ دِينُ الْقَيِّمَةِ
ayat.transliteration: Wa mā umirū illā liya'budullāha mukhliṣīna lahud-dīna ḥunafā'a wayuqīmuṣ-ṣalāta wayu'tuz-zakāh, wa dhālika dīnul-qayyimah
ayat.meaning: And they were not commanded except to worship Allah, [being] sincere to Him in religion, inclining to truth, and to establish prayer and to give zakah. And that is the correct religion.

ayat.arabic: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا مِنْ أَهْلِ الْكِتَابِ وَالْمُشْرِكِينَ فِي نَارِ جَهَنَّمَ خَالِدِينَ فِيهَا ۚ أُولَٰئِكَ هُمْ شَرُّ الْبَرِيَّةِ
ayat.transliteration: Innal-ladhīna kafarū min ahlil-kitābi wal-mushrikīna fī nāri jahannama khālidīna fīhā, ulā'ika hum sharrul-bariyyah
ayat.meaning: Indeed, they who disbelieved among the People of the Scripture and the polytheists will be in the fire of Hell, abiding eternally therein. Those are the worst of creatures.

ayat.arabic: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ أُولَٰئِكَ هُمْ خَيْرُ الْبَرِيَّةِ
ayat.transliteration: Innal-ladhīna āmanū wa 'amiluṣ-ṣāliḥāti ulā'ika hum khayrul-bariyyah
ayat.meaning: Indeed, they who have believed and done righteous deeds - those are the best of creatures.

ayat.arabic: جَزَاؤُهُمْ عِندَ رَبِّهِمْ جَنَّاتُ عَدْنٍ تَجْرِي مِن تَحْتِهَا الْأَنْهَارُ خَالِدِينَ فِيهَا أَبَدًا ۖ رَّضِيَ اللَّهُ عَنْهُمْ وَرَضُوا عَنْهُ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ لِمَنْ خَشِيَ رَبَّهُ
ayat.transliteration: Jazā'uhum 'inda rabbihim jannātu 'adnin tajrī min taḥtihal-anhāru khālidīna fīhā abadā, raḍiyallāhu 'anhum wa raḍū 'anh, dhālika liman khashiya rabbah
ayat.meaning: Their reward with their Lord will be gardens of perpetual residence beneath which rivers flow, abiding therein forever. Allah is pleased with them and they are pleased with Him. That is for whoever has feared his Lord.
In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful.
Indeed, We sent it [the Quran] down during the Night of Decree.
And what can make you know what is the Night of Decree?

ayat.arabic: لَيْلَةُ الْقَدْرِ خَيْرٌ مِّنْ أَلْفِ شَهْرٍ
ayat.meaning: The Night of Decree is better than a thousand months.

ayat.arabic: تَنَزَّلُ الْمَلَائِكَةُ وَالرُّوحُ فِيهَا بِإِذْنِ رَبِّهِم مِّن كُلِّ أَمْرٍ
ayat.transliteration: Tanazzalul-malā'ikatu war-rūhu fīhā bi'idhni rabbihim min kulli amr
ayat.meaning: The angels and the Spirit [Jibril] descend therein by permission of their Lord for every matter.
Peace it is until the emergence of dawn.
In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful.
Read in the name of your Lord who created -
Created man from a clinging clot.
Read, and your Lord is the Most Generous -
Who taught by the pen -
Taught man that which he knew not.
No! [But] indeed, man transgresses
Because he sees himself self-sufficient.
Indeed, to your Lord is the return.
Have you seen the one who forbids
A servant when he prays?
Have you seen if he is upon guidance
Or enjoins righteousness?
Have you seen if he denies and turns away -
Does he not know that Allah sees?

ayat.arabic: كَلَّا لَئِن لَّمْ يَنتَهِ لَنَسْفَعًا بِالنَّاصِيَةِ
ayat.transliteration: Kallā la'il lam yantahi lanasfa'am bin-nāṣiyah
ayat.meaning: No! If he does not desist, We will surely drag him by the forelock -
A lying, sinning forelock.
Then let him call his associates;
We will call the angels of Hell.
No! Do not obey him. But prostrate and draw near [to Allah].
In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful.
By the fig and the olive
And [by] Mount Sinai
And [by] this secure city [Makkah],

ayat.arabic: لَقَدْ خَلَقْنَا الْإِنْسَانَ فِي أَحْسَنِ تَقْوِيمٍ
ayat.meaning: We have certainly created man in the best of stature;
Then We return him to the lowest of the low,

ayat.arabic: إِلَّا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ فَلَهُمْ أَجْرٌ غَيْرُ مَمْنُونٍ
ayat.transliteration: Illal-ladhīna āmanū wa 'amiluṣ-ṣāliḥāti fa lahum ajrun ghairu mamnūn
ayat.meaning: Except for those who believe and do righteous deeds, for they will have a reward uninterrupted.
So what yet causes you to deny the Recompense?
Is not Allah the most just of judges?
In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful.
Did We not expand for you, [O Muhammad], your breast?
And We removed from you your burden
Which had weighed upon your back
And raised high for you your repute.
For indeed, with hardship [will be] ease.
Indeed, with hardship [will be] ease.
So when you have finished [your duties], then stand up [for worship]
And to your Lord direct [your] longing.
In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful.
By the morning brightness
And by the night when it covers with darkness,

ayat.transliteration: Mā wadda'aka rabbuka wa mā qalā
ayat.meaning: Your Lord has not taken leave of you, [O Muhammad], nor has He detested [you].
And the Hereafter is better for you than the first [life].
And your Lord is going to give you, and you will be satisfied.
Did He not find you an orphan and give [you] refuge?
And He found you lost and guided [you]?
And He found you poor and made [you] self-sufficient?
So as for the orphan, do not oppress [him].
And as for the petitioner, do not repel [him].
But as for the favor of your Lord, report [it].
